intro: Vincetoxicum × purpurascens var. albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower false bindweed, is a hybrid perennial plant characterized by its distinctive white flowers. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is native to Europe. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms. However, it can be invasive in some regions if not properly managed.
